TopicTitle: RC-001S Command Pod Too Large For 1.25m Heatshield

Articles.Content:
I learned the excruciatingly painful way that the 1.25m heatshield is not large enough for the RC-001S command pod - it is about 10 cm too large and your probe explodes on re-entry from the heat.

This model for the RC-001S needs to be scaled down so it is LESS than 1.25m.  This problem actually exists for most of the heatshields where they are the EXACT size of most of the objects they were designed-for, making them almost useless unless you want to always use the next-largest size (which is ridiculous).

Edited February 15, 2017 by Caelib

It's a tricky one to balance. If you make a heat shield larger than standard size then it should be a lot more draggy on the way up because of this. 

One thing that you can try is not putting the RC-001S next to the heat shield. I've just tried and with the first craft here the probe core over-heats on re-entry but doesn't on the second...
Yeah, those work-arounds are OK, but the root of the problem is we need part sizes that are practical -- if only they would implement tweakscale into stock
Take a look at the aeroshell used for the Viking landers.  That thing was frickin' huge compared to the footprint of the actual lander.

There are a few parts that seem to be just a tad too big/small for what should be the "standard" diameter.

Making the heat shield bigger isn't the solution... making that probe core slightly smaller is.
